data.title: New on Netflix UK in March 2020 - Film and TV releases
data.meta_description: A whole host of new television series and films are on their way to Netflix with returns for TV favourites for Elite and Ozark
data.text:
It's another month which means another month of great content to watch on Netflix.

The streaming giant has whole host of new series, documentaries and films to be enjoyed.

Netflix favourites such as teen drama Elite and award-winning crime series Ozark each return for their unmissable third seasons, while we also have an all-new fantasy series fresh on the heels of The Witcher, entitled The Letter for the King.

Meanwhile, the production company that belongs to former US president Barack Obama and his wife Michelle Obama brings us a new documentary that explores a revolutionary camp for the disabled in the 1970s, Crip Camp: A Disability Revolution.

There's also a wealth of family content, comedy specials, and continuing shows such as Better Call Saul and Riverdale to enjoy.

So, let's dive in!

New on Netflix UK in March 2020 - Film and TV releases

Netflix Original TV series

Paradise PD: Part 2- March 3

The squad contends with bitter feuds, kinky fetishes, dirty schemes, and a nuclear threat, as the Kingpin tightens his grip on Paradise.

The Protector: Season 3 - March 3

Hakan faces a formidable Immortal who seeks to possess the key to destroying the city as chaos reigns in Istanbul.

On My Block: Season 3- March 11

On My Block is a coming of age comedy about four bright and street-savvy friends navigating their way through the triumph, pain and the newness of a rough inner-city high school.

Hospital Playlist - March 12

Five doctors with strong friendships work in the VIP wing of a hospital.

Elite: Season 3 - March 13

When another classmate is killed, a new investigation ensues. The students look toward their future, while the consequences of the past haunt them.

Women of the Night- March 13

The wife of a rising star in Amsterdam's mayoral office is haunted by her past as she finds herself drawn into the city's underworld of sex and drugs.

Kingdom: Season 2- March 13

The zombie period drama returns for a new season.

Bloodride - March 13

A Norwegian anthology horror series with a twisted humour.

The Valhalla Murders - March 13

An Icelandic detective visits Norway to investigate a series of awful murders.

100 Humans- March 13

One hundred diverse volunteers participate in experiments that tackle questions about age, gender, happiness and other aspects of being human.

Feel Good - March 20

Mae Martin stars as herself, a Canadian comedian living in London while navigating romance and sobriety.

The Letter for the King - March 20

An epic new fantasy series focused on a boy trying to deliver a message that holds the future of the kingdom in its contents.

Self Made: Inspired by the Life of Madam C.J. Walker: Limited Series- March 20

A drama inspired by the true story of Madam C.J. Walker, who was the first African American female self-made millionaire.

Dare Me- March 20

Mystery, drama and danger hit a high school cheerleading squad as a new coach arrives in town and disrupts the power balance ruled by brash Beth and her loyal BFF Addy.

The English Game - Coming Soon

Two footballers reach across the class divide to bring football to the masses in 1870s London.

Signs - March 25

When a young woman's murder shows similarities to a decade-old cold case, a new police commander must break the silence permeating an Owl Mountain town.

Unorthodox- March 26

Fleeing an arranged marriage in Berlin, a woman arrives in Brooklyn, but her past follows her.

Black Lightning: Season 3 - March 26

Cress Williams ("Prison Break") brings DC's first major African American superhero to life in the third season of the heroic drama.

Ozark: Season 3- March 27

It's six months later, the casino is up and running, but Marty and Wendy are fighting for control of the family's destiny. Marty preaches keeping the status quo. Aided by an alliance with Helen and drug cartel leader Omar Navarro, Wendy plots for expansion. But when Wendy's brother Ben comes into town, everyone's lives are thrown into chaos.

Il processo- March 27

The murder of a teen girl impacts a public prosecutor linked to the victim, a lawyer seeking a career-making case and a suspect who says she's innocent.

Car Masters: Rust to Riches: Season 2 - March 27

Classic cars get massive makeovers courtesy of Gotham Garage, a skilled California crew dedicated to upgrading and trading sweet vintage vehicles.

Weekly Continuing Series

Better Call Saul: Season 5- Every Monday

Changing his name to Saul Goodman, Jimmy recruits a new crop of clients in the new run of the Breaking Bad spin-off. Meanwhile, Kim wrestles with a moral dilemma at work and Lalo's feud with Gus heats up.

Riverdale: Season 4 - Every Thursday

Senior year in Riverdale continues as Archie Andrews adjusts to life without his father Fred (the late Luke Perry).

Netflix Original Film

I am Jonas - March 6

Jonas is haunted by his teenage love affair with the impulsive, twisted and yet irresistible Nathan.

Guilty - March 6

A college heartthrob is accused of rape by a less popular student, prompting his girlfriend to search for the truth.

Spenser Confidential - March 6

Just out of prison and investigating a twisted murder, Spenser is sucked back into Boston’s underbelly. Stars Mark Wahlberg.

Sitara: Let Girls Dream- March 8

Sitara: Let Girls Dream is an animated short film that follows the story of Pari, a 14-year-old girl with dreams of becoming a pilot, while growing up in a society that doesn’t allow her to dream.

El silencio de la ciudad blanca- March 6

A detective inspector investigates ritualistic murders n Spain's Basque Country for two decades.

Go Karts - March 13

After moving to a new town with his mom, a teen discovers the high-speed sport of go-kart racing, learning from a former driver with a secret past.

Lost Girls- March 13

Based on a true story, a mother investigates her daughter's disappearance and uncovers a series of awful murders. Amy Ryan and Gabriel Byrne star.

Ultras- March 20

A story of intergenerational friendship and coming of age, set in the world of ultras culture during the last five weeks of a soccer championship.

Maska - March 20

A young man wants nothing more than to be a movie star, but a summer romance shows there's a difference between dreams and delusions. Starring Manisha Koirala.

The Platform - March 20

In a prison where food quality is indicative of power, one man rebels against he system..

Curtiz - March 25

Ambitious but difficult film director Michael Curtiz deals with studio politics and domestic issues during the troubled production of "Casablanca" in 1942.

The Decline - March 27

Antoine attends Alain's survivalist retreat to prepare for disasters. Apprehending a natural, economical or social breakdown, the group goes through drills meant to prepare them for apocalypses of all types. However, catastrophe awaits.

Uncorked- March 27

A man goes against his father's wishes to become a master sommelier instead of joining the family's barbecue business.

Mark of the Devil- March 27

A possessed priest must wrestle his demons as an ancient evil is unleashed.

The Occupant (Hogar)- March 25

An unemployed executive is forced to sell his apartment. When he discovers that he still has the keys, he becomes obsessed with the family that lives there and will do anything to go back to the life he had before.

Netflix Original Comedy

Taylor Tomlinson: Quarter-Life Crisis - March 3

Now halfway through her twenties, Taylor Tomlinson is ready to leave her mistakes behind her. Taylor talks about working on yourself, realistic relationship goals, and why your twenties are not actually “the best years of your life.”

Marc Maron: End Times Fun- March 10

A new stand-up special from comedian Marc Maron.

Bert Kreischer: Hey Big Boy- March 17

Comedian Bert Kreischer is back, and shirtless once again, in his second Netflix Original comedy special, Bert Kreischer: Hey Big Boy.

Ladies Up - Coming Soon

Rising India-based comics Prashasti Singh, Kaneez Surka, Supriya Joshi and Niveditha Prakasam bring no-holds-barred humour.

Netflix Documentaries

Ugly Delicious: Season 2- March 6

The second season of the hit series continues to challenge both our taste buds and our minds as Chef Chang travels the world with writers and chefs, activists and artists and tackles misconceptions and uncover shared experiences.

Dirty Money: Season 2- March 11

This season offers a look inside Jared Kushner’s real estate empire, the Wells Fargo banking scandal and Malaysia’s 1MDB corruption case.

Fangio: El hombre que domaba las maquinas - March 20

Juan Manuel Fangio was the Formula One king, winning five world championships in the early 1950s —when the sport was much more deadly.

Tiger King- March 20

A vicious feud between big cat eccentrics takes a dark turn when Joe Exotic, a controversial animal park boss, is caught in a murder-for-hire plot .

ARASHI's Diary -Voyage-: Episode 3 & 4 - Coming Soon

Twenty years after their debut, join the beloved members of Arashi on a new journey as they showcase their lives, talents and gifts to the world.

Crip Camp: A Disability Revolution - March 25

A documentary from the production company owned by Barack Obama and Michelle Obama.

In the early 1970s, teenagers with disabilities faced a future shaped by isolation, discrimination and institutionalization. Camp Jened, a ramshackle camp “for the handicapped” in the Catskills, exploded those confines. Jened was their freewheeling Utopia, a place with summertime sports, smoking and make out sessions awaiting everyone, and campers felt fulfilled as human beings.

Their bonds endured as they migrated West to Berkeley, California — a promised land for a growing and diverse disability community — where friends from Camp Jened realized that disruption and unity might secure life-changing accessibility for millions.

Netflix Kids & Family

Go! Go! Cory Carson: Season 2- March 1

The adventures of Cory continue with this second season.

Mighty Little Bheem: Festival of Colours- March 5

Join baby Bheem for all his Holi hijinks during the special spring festival.

Carmen Sandiego: To Steal or Not to Steal- March 10

An interactive adventure which sees Carmen save Ivy and Zack when V.I.L.E. captures them during a heist in Shanghai.

The Boss Baby: Back in Business: Season 3- March 16

Boss Baby goes freelance and turns his playgroup into a makeshift field team.

Shaun the Sheep: Adventures from Mossy Bottom- March 17

More antics with everyone's favourite Aardman Animations sheep.

Greenhouse Academy: Season 4 - March 20

The teen drama based on the award-winning Israeli series "Ha-Hamama" returns for Season 4.

Archibald's Next Big Thing: Season 2 - March 20

Archibald can't wait to experience everything this great, big world has to offer as a new seasona rrives.

Dino Girl Gauko: Season 2- March 20

In a bizarre town, Naoko and her friends have more strange adventures with aliens, robots and dinosaur girl Gauko.

Buddi - March 20

Following the five best of "Buddis".

YooHoo to the Rescue: Season 3- March 25

Join YooHoo and his adorable crew as they travel the world to help animal friends.

Dragons: Rescue Riders: Hunt for the Golden Dragon- March 27

Rescue Riders do all they can to keep the dragon eggs away from the pirates.

True: Wuzzle Wegg Day- March 27

When searching for the perfect Wuzzle Wegg, Bartleby thinks he sees a monster. Will the Rainbow King have to cancel Wuzzle Wegg Day — or will True come to the rescue?

Netflix Anime

Castlevania: Season 3- March 5

Alucard mentors a pair of admirers, Belmont and Sypha settle into a village with sinister secrets, and Isaac embarks on a quest to locate Hector.

BEASTARS- March 13

A gentle wolf awakens to his own predatory urges as his school deals with a murder within its midst.

Altered Carbon: Resleeved- March 19

The Altered Carbon universe expands with this brand-new anime tale.

Sol Levante- March 23

The world's first 4K HDR native hand-drawn anime short.

7SEEDS: Part 2 - March 26

In a post-apocalyptic future, the world is dangerous, but not as deadly as their fellow humans.
